content:
• Thursday, February 15, 2018
  • INST

    Instructure -6.4% after launching 2.3M-share offering at discount

    • Instructure (NYSE:INST) is 6.4% lower after hours following news that it will seek a public offering of 2.3M shares.
    • The shares are said to be offered at $39-$40 each, Bloomberg reports -- a 2.9%-5.3% discount vs. today's close of $41.20. Shares are quoting at $38.55 after hours.
    • All shares to be sold are being sold by the company. Underwriters will have a 30-day option to buy up to an additional 345,000 shares.
    • Net proceeds are set for general purposes.
    • Morgan Stanley and Credit Suisse are book-running managers.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:54 PM
  • GOOG

    Google buying IoT platform Xively from LogMeIn for $50M

    • Google (GOOG, GOOGL) says it will buy Xively, an established Internet-of-Things platform, from LogMeIn (NASDAQ:LOGM) for $50M.
    • LogMeIn is off 7.7% after hours; GOOG +0.1%; GOOGL +0.2%.
    • The move will accelerate Google Cloud's move into the IoT market, which it says will reach 20B connected devices by 2020.
    • Meanwhile, LogMeIn is getting out of the area: "Does this mean LogMeIn is exiting the IoT? Well, if you mean the IoT connectivity platform space, yes, we’re leaving it. We believe that Google Cloud, now armed with Xively’s team and great technology – and backed by their platform and developer heritage and reach – are a far better fit for the future of platform leadership,” the company says.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:47 PM | 9 Comments
  • MCHX

    Marchex down after trimming losses in Q4

    • Marchex (NASDAQ:MCHX) fell 2.9% after hours after its Q4 report where it trimmed losses substantially and swung to a gain on an adjusted basis.
    • The company beat expectations (one estimate) for profits and revenues, with headline net loss coming to $841,000 vs. a year-ago loss of $5.7M.
    • On a non-GAAP basis, EPS was $0.01 vs. a year-ago -$0.04.
    • For Q1, it's guiding to revenue of $21M or more (vs. one estimate for $25.3M) and EBITDA of break-even of better (vs. estimate for $0.3M).
    • Press release
     
     
     
     
    | 7:23 PM
  • TPC

    Tutor Perini-led JV wins $1.4B contract to rebuild Newark airport

    • Tutor Perini (NYSE:TPC) +1.9% after-hours on news that the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey awarded a contract valued at $1.4B to its joint venture for the 1M sq. ft. Newark Airport Terminal One Design-Build Project.
    • The project will be the largest transportation infrastructure design-build contract in New Jersey's history.
    • TPC says work on the project is expected to begin this April and substantial completion is anticipated in 2022.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:07 PM
  • GOGO

    Gogo rises as William Blair eyes prospect of short squeeze

    • Gogo (NASDAQ:GOGO) jumped 7.9% today, erasing February declines, after a note from William Blair hinted at potential for a short squeeze.
    • Sentiment is too negative, analyst Louie DiPalma wrote, and it's set for a rebound or squeeze (considering short interest is 25% higher than when the stock was at an all-time low in 2016) in conjunction with earnings next week. (h/t Bloomberg)
    • The company doesn't have to do anything "extraordinary" to trade into the $20s next year other than install ilts backlog and keep riding trends, he says.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:22 PM | 10 Comments
  • SNCR

    After Hours Gainers / Losers (2/15/2018)

    • Top gainers: SNCR +28.3%. CDLX +17.5%. TNDM +7.9%. SJM +3.5%. MULE +1.6%.
    • Top losers: COHU -17.0%. ANET -16.0%. PCRX -13.7%. CGNX -11.5%. PI -8.2%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:36 PM | 2 Comments
  • IO

    ION Geophysical to launch public offering

    • ION Geophysical (NYSE:IO) -8% after-hours following news it plans a public offering of common stock and warrants, with a probable underwriters option to purchase additional shares and warrants.
    • The size and specific purpose of the offering is not yet disclosed.
    • IO shares have surged more than 50% since issuing strong Q4 results after the close on Feb. 7.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:28 PM | 14 Comments
  • FLS

    Flowserve falls 4% after Q4 earnings miss, downside 2018 guidance

    • Flowserve (NYSE:FLS) -4.1% after-hours as it narrowly misses Q4 earnings expectations while guiding 2018 earnings below consensus.
    • FLS says Q4 profit fell to $65.8M, or $0.50/share, from $89.6M, or $0.68/share, in last year's Q4, and Q4 revenues slipped 3.4% (7.1% on a constant currency basis) to $1.03B.
    • Q4 bookings totaled $985M, up 8.5% Y/Y (4.7% on a constant currency basis), resulting in a year-end 2017 backlog of $2.03B, up 6.9% Y/Y.
    • FLS issues mixed guidance for FY 2018, seeing EPS of $1.50-$1.70 vs. $1.85 analyst consensus estimate and revenue growth of 3%-6%, which should result in total revenues of $3.77B-$3.88B vs. $3.74B consensus.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:12 PM | 2 Comments
  • PI

    Impinj -7.3% after Q4 misses, soft guidance

    • Impinj (NASDAQ:PI) shares are down 7.3% aftermarket following Q4 results that missed EPS and revenue estimates.
    • Q1 guidance: Revenue, $23.25M to $25.25M (was: $20M to $22M; consensus: $21.22M); EPS, -$0.42 to -$0.35 (consensus: -$0.34).
    • Management comment (CEO Chris Diorio): "As we announced earlier this month, we anticipate softness in our first-quarter 2018 endpoint IC volumes and revenue due to shortened lead times contributing to a reduction in our order backlog, as well as ongoing reductions in inlay-partner inventory. We remain confident in our market opportunity, position, and in our vision of identifying, locating and authenticating every item in our everyday world, and connecting every one of those items to the cloud." 
    • Earnings call is scheduled for 5 PM Eastern Time with a webcast available here. 
    • Press release    
    • Previously: Impinj misses by $0.09, misses on revenue (Feb. 15)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:00 PM | 3 Comments
  • DLR

    Digital Realty down after Q4 FFO miss

    • Digital Realty Trust (NYSE:DLR) is down 2.3% in late trading after Q4 earnings where reported and adjusted FFO measures missed slightly.
    • Adjusted FFO/share of $1.35 missed consensus for $1.39. Reported FFO/share of $1.48 was down from a year-ago $1.58; Core FFO of $1.55, however, was up from $1.43.
    • Signed bookings in Q4 are expected to generate $56M of annualized rental revenue; that brings full-year 2017 bookings to $199M.
    • Net income came to $80M, $0.26/share vs. a year-ago $0.49/share.
    • It reiterated a 2018 outlook for core FFO/share of $6.45-$6.60 and EPS of $1.50-$1.55, based on assumptions of total revenue of $3B-$3.2B; adjusted EBITDA margin of 58-60%; and G&A margin of 5.5-6%. Rental rates on renewal leases or expected to be slightly negative on a cash basis, and up mid-single-digits on a GAAP basis.
    • Conference call to come at 5:30 p.m. ET.
    • Press release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:47 PM | 4 Comments
  • CGNX

    Cognex -11.7% after in-line Q4 EPS, in-line guidance

    • Cognex (NASDAQ:CGNX) shares are down 11.7% aftermarket following Q4 results that beat revenue estimates but met on EPS. In-line Q1 guidance has revenue of $165M to $175M (consensus: $173.41M).
    • More Q1 guidance: Company expects typical seasonal decline on the quarter in factory automation. Gross margin expected in the mid-70% range, within the target range under the new revenue recognition standard. Operating expenses expected up mid-single digits on the quarter.  
    • Key metrics: Gross margin, 77% (-3 percentage points Y/Y); Research, Development & Engineering expense growth, +39%; SG&A expense growth, 41%; cash and equivalents, $828M. 
    • Tax impact: Company took a one-time charge of $83M due to the U.S tax reform including repatriated earnings tax, revaluation of deferred tax positions to lower rate, and the recharacterization of certain income. 
    • Earnings call is scheduled for 5 PM Eastern Time with a webcast available here. 
    • Press release     
    • Previously: Cognex EPS in-line, beats on revenue (Feb. 15)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:43 PM | 14 Comments
  • ANET

    Arista Networks -11.4% despite 43% revenue gain for Q4

    • Arista Networks (NYSE:ANET) is down 11.4% in early postmarket trading despite Q4 results that topped expectations and revenue guidance in line with Street expectations for the current quarter.
    • Revenues rose 42.7% Y/Y, and 6.9% from Q3. Gross margin rose as well, to 65.9% on a non-GAAP basis from 64.4% last year and 64.4% in the third quarter.
    • Net income rose to $103.8M from $58.8M on a GAAP basis; on a non-GAAP basis, net income rose to $137.3M from $77.5M.
    • The year marked a "market tipping point with Arista’s disruptive software-driven architecture gaining mainstream acceptance as we surpassed 15 million cumulative ports of cloud networking,” says CEO Jayshree Ullal.
    • Revenue breakout: Product, $407.2M (up 41%); Service, $60.7M (up 55.7%).
    • For Q1, it's guiding to revenue of $450M-$468M (vs. consensus for $457.8M), non-GAAP gross margin of 63-65% and operating margin of about 32%.
    • Conference call to come at 4:30 p.m. ET.
    • Press release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:20 PM | 69 Comments
  • SHAK

    Shake Shack keeps growth plans on the plate

    • Shake Shack (NYSE:SHAK) trades slightly higher after topping Q4 estimates.
    • Same-shack sales increased 0.8% during the quarter vs. -0.9% consensus. 43 Shacks were in the comparable base, compared to 29 a year ago.
    • Average weekly sales per store fell 5.6% to $85K.
    • The company reported adjusted EBITDA rose 31% Y/Y to $14.9M.
    • Shack level operating margin came in at 25.2% of sales during the quarter vs. 25.4% a year ago.
    • CEO update: "Looking ahead, 2018 is shaping up to be another exciting year of growth with 32 to 35 new domestic company-operated Shacks, our biggest year of openings to date. We expect 16 to 18 net new licensed Shacks for the year, with a significant portion of our international growth targeted in Asia including our first Shack in Hong Kong."
    • Shake Shack guides for full-year revenue of $444M-$448M vs. $457.2M consensus.
    • Previously: Shake Shack beats by $0.04, beats on revenue (Feb. 15)
    • SHAK+0.29% AH to $41.33.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:16 PM | 1 Comment
  • CBS

    CBS beats by $0.01, beats on revenue

    • CBS (NYSE:CBS): Q4 EPS of $1.15 beats by $0.01.
    • Revenue of $3.92B (+11.4% Y/Y) beats by $220M.
    • Shares +2.57%.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:12 PM | 8 Comments
  • SNBR

    Sleep Number beats by $0.14, beats on revenue

    • Sleep Number (NASDAQ:SNBR): Q4 EPS of $0.33 beats by $0.14.
    • Revenue of $363.28M (+15.9% Y/Y) beats by $31.56M.
    • Shares +11.56%.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:08 PM
  • SHAK

    Shake Shack beats by $0.04, beats on revenue

    • Shake Shack (NYSE:SHAK): Q4 EPS of $0.10 beats by $0.04.
    • Revenue of $96.14M (+31.2% Y/Y) beats by $3.27M.
    • Shares +4.54%.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:07 PM | 4 Comments
  • TRUE

    TrueCar beats by $0.05, beats on revenue

    • TrueCar (NASDAQ:TRUE): Q4 EPS of $0.05 beats by $0.05.
    • Revenue of $83.1M (+12.2% Y/Y) beats by $1.3M.
    • Shares +3%.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:07 PM | 2 Comments
  • EQT

    EQT +10% following big Q4 beat

    • EQT Corp. (EQT +10%) cruises to a 10% gain after crushing Wall Street expectations for Q4 earnings and revenues on the back of higher commodity prices and sales volume.
    • EQT forecasts FY 2018 total production sales volume of 1,520-1,560 Bcfe, with liquids volume of 12.3M-12.6M boe, while Q1 volume is seen at 350-360 Bcfe with liquids volume of 3.23M-3.25M boe.
    • The company says it spud 197 gross wells in 2017, including 144 wells drilled in the Marcellus, 49 in the Upper Devonian and four in the Utica play.
    • EQT also reports year-end 2017 proved reserves of 21.4T cfe, up 59% Y/Y, primarily driven by 6.3T cfe of acquisitions; excluding those, the company added 2.2T cfe of proved reserves, which was 245% more than full-year production.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:59 PM
  • TKC

    Turkcell gains as revenues, EBITDA hit records

    • Turkcell (NYSE:TKC) is up 2.4% in the wake of Q4 earnings where the company hit all-time high revenues and EBITDA.
    • It also hit a nine-year high for EBITDA margin, at 37.3%, up 3.4 percentage points.
    • Revenues rose 15.4%, and EBITDA rose 26.8%.
    • Net income, meanwhile, doubled to 716M Turkish lira after excluding an impact of 500M lira from tax settlement.
    • For guidance, it's targeting group revenue growth of 13-15%, EBITDA margin of 33-35%, and operational capex-to-sales ratio of 18-19%.
    • Press release
     
     
     
     
    | 3:56 PM
  • HRTX

    Heron up 3% after Ad Com thumbs down on Pacira Pharma's Exparel

    • Heron Therapeutics (HRTX +3.2%) is up, albeit on below-average volume, after a negative FDA advisory committee vote on Pacira Pharmaceuticals' anesthetic drug EXPAREL (bupivacaine liposomal injectable solution).
    • Heron also has a local anesthetic candidate, HTX-011, a combination of bupivacaine and meloxicam. It plans to file a U.S. marketing application this year.
    • Previously: Heron Therapeutics' pain candidate HTX-011 shows positive effect in mid-stage studies; shares down 8% after hours on soft Sustol guidance (Jan. 4, 2017)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:45 PM
  • CMP

    Compass Minerals cut to Underperform at Credit Suisse after dim 2018 view

    • Compass Minerals (CMP -6.6%) is downgraded to Underperform from Neutral with a $60 price target, trimmed from $63, at Credit Suisse, after the company issued weak 2018 guidance while reporting better than expected Q4 earnings.
    • The firm foresees multiple risks ahead for CMP including seasonal conditions in Brazil, mild winters, pressure on sulfate of potash premiums as muriate of potash prices fall, and increasing transportation costs driven by driver shortages, fuel expenses and capacity constraints.
    • CMP said it expects FY 2018 EPS of $2.75-$3.25 vs. $3.54 analyst consensus estimate, and outlook that "places significant pressure on H2 2018 to deliver much needed growth, but we believe multiple risk factors blur earnings visibility," Credit Suisse writes.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:34 PM | 2 Comments
  • HL

    Hecla Mining posts Q4 miss as lack of Lucky Friday production weighs

    • Hecla Mining (HL -3.4%) is lower after posting a surprise Q4 loss, as the strike at its Lucky Friday mine holds down the company's production results.
    • HL says sales for Q4 and FY 2017 were 3% and 11% lower, respectively, than the same periods in 2016, mainly due to lower silver, zinc and lead production due to the ongoing strike at the Lucky Friday mine in Idaho.
    • Q4 silver production at Lucky Friday totaled just 69.5K oz. vs. 874K oz. in the year-ago quarter, but HL says it has agreed to binding third-party arbitration with the United Steelworkers in an attempt to end the strike, subject to a ratification vote by union members in March.
    • HL says average realized silver prices in Q4 and FY 2017 were $16.87/oz. and $17.23/oz., respectively, both slightly higher than the year-ago periods; realized prices for gold in Q4 and the full year were $1,278/oz. and $1,261/oz., respectively, 6% and 1% higher than the prior periods.
    • For 2018, HL projects silver output of 9.5M-10.5 M oz., excluding any production from Lucky Friday, and gold production of 218K-232K oz., following 2017 production of 12.5M silver oz. (down 27% from 2016) and 232.7K oz. of gold (nearly flat Y/Y).
     
     
     
     
    | 3:19 PM | 5 Comments
  • HAL

    Halliburton sand delivery problems may be widespread, analyst says

    • Oilfield service companies are mostly lower after Halliburton (HAL -2.3%) Executive VP and CFO Christopher Weber said the company's Q1 earnings would be reduced by $0.10/share due to delays in deliveries of sand used in fracking.
    • Goldman Sachs analyst Waqar Syed thinks HAL's delivery delays likely are widespread across the industry and Q1 estimates for the entire oil service industry are at risk, although he maintains his view that fundamentals in the business are strong (source: Briefing.com).
    • But Tudor Pickering Holt's Byron Pope believes the delays will not affect other oilfield services companies, saying "this feels to me as though it’s more of a Halliburton-specific issue.”
    • SLB +0.1%, WFT -0.5%, BHGE -0.8%, NOV -0.8%, WFT -0.7%, NBR -2.4%, HP -1.2%, PTEN -1.5%, RIG -1.3%, ESV -0.8%, DO -2.5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:57 PM | 33 Comments
  • SEDG

    Technology - Top Gainers / Losers as of 2.55 pm (2/15/18)

    • Gainers: SEDG +23%. OTCPK:LBCC +20%. SYNT +19%. OHGI +11%. DPW +10%.
    • Losers: INPX -23%. LIVE -16%. QUIK -13%. MARK -11%. MATR -10%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:56 PM | 1 Comment
  • AMZN

    Yahoo Finance: Amazon plans to combine AmazonFresh and Prime Now

    • The layoffs at Amazon (NASDAQ:AMZN) HQ come as the company works to consolidate its Amazon Prime Now and AmazonFresh businesses, according to Yahoo Finance sources.
    • Prime Now offers two-hour delivery for Prime members in certain areas. AmazonFresh offers grocery delivery (in certain areas) at an additional membership fee of $14.99/month. 
    • The consolidation could streamline the delivery experience for the Whole Foods side of the business. 
    • Amazon had already begun scaling back the AmazonFresh presence shortly after the Whole Foods acquisition. 
    • Amazon shares are up 0.88%.  
    • Previously: Recode reports Amazon blames USPS for Fresh failures; Amazon Go soon public? (Nov. 15, 2017)
    • Previously: Seattle Times: Amazon cutting several hundred HQ jobs (Feb. 12)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:40 PM | 23 Comments
  • BA

    Boeing expects to produce 900-plus planes a year by 2020, CEO says

    • Boeing (BA +3%) moves out to a ~3% gain, contributing about a third of the Dow's 200-plus point gain so far today, and is now 20% higher YTD after recouping its dropoff from the recent broader stock market selloff.
    • CEO Dennis Muilenburg told CNBC today that by the end of the decade Boeing will be building more than 900 airplanes per year after delivering a record 763 commercial aircraft last year.
    • "We see air traffic growing and passenger traffic growing at about 6%-7% a year, and that's feeding airplane growth throughout the world," Muilenburg said, adding that the world's aircraft fleets will double in size over the next 20 years and cause a need for 41K new airplanes.
    • Separately, Reuters reports Boeing has applied to stay in the race to supply Canada with 88 new fighter jets, despite angering Canada's government by launching its trade challenge against Bombardier.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:38 PM | 6 Comments
  • YNDX

    Yandex +8.4% on Sherbank e-commerce JV

    • Yandex (NASDAQ:YNDX) and Sherbank could complete a JV in March based on the former’s e-commerce platform, according to comments from the state bank’s CEO.
    • The partnership was first revealed last summer with a binding agreement entered in December with word that the transaction would close in 1H18. 
    • Yandex shares are up 8.4%.  
    • Previously: Yandex misses by $0.03, beats on revenue (Feb. 15)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:28 PM | 5 Comments
  • CSCO

    Cisco hits 17-year high after beat, analyst target hikes

    • Cisco Systems (NASDAQ:CSCO) is up 4.6% today and tagged its highest point in 17 years, since the dot-com bust, after a stellar earnings report that spurred analysts to raise price targets with eyes on the sunny outlook.
    • Cowen had expected signals that growth was ahead, and was pleased to see it's "no longer on the horizon -- it has arrived." Analyst Paul Silverstein pointed to Q2 operating cash flow of $4.1B, up $300M and strongest Q2 flow in company history. He's raised his price target to $51 from $42 and sticking with an Outperform rating.
    • BofA Merrill Lynch raised its target to $53 from $46, implying 20%-plus upside. The company's transition toward software sales and recurring revenues is going well, and momentum could lead margins to expand to 64.5% within two years, says Tal Liani, projecting EPS growth of 8%, 10% and 7% for the next three years.
    • KeyBanc raised its target to $49 from $43, based on a positive outlook on shares amid beats driven by the recurring-revenue transition and strong order rates fueled by a Catalyst 900 refresh cycle.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:17 PM | 14 Comments
  • AAPL

    Apple Q4 performance: 12% China growth, 51% of global smartphone revenue

    • Morgan Stanley says Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL) iPhone shipments grew 12% in China in CY17 Q4 (Q/Q) while Android shipments declined 17%.
    • In the four-week period ending January 14, the iPhone’s market share in the region dropped to 20.6% of active phones from 21.8% in the prior four weeks. 
    • The decline hit older models like the iPhone 6 likely due to domestic phone makers slashing prices to compete. But the iPhone X continued to accelerate in the period, representing over 3% of the iPhone active installed base.
    • Global Q4: Strategy Analytics has estimates for global smartphone revenue for Q4 and Apple captured 51% of wholesale revenues with an ASP of $800, which is 3x the industry average. 
    • Samsung’s ASP grew 21% to $254 (thanks to the pricier Galaxy S8 and Galaxy Note 8). 
    • Apple shares are up 3.1%.   
     
     
     
     
    | 2:13 PM | 141 Comments
  • NLY

    Mortgage REITs move sharply higher as earnings roll in

    • Is it possible the bad news has been priced into the mREITs? The sector is lit up bright green today following Q4 reports from Annaly (NLY +2.4%), Armour (ARR +1.4%), Anworth (ANH +2%), and MFA Financial (MFA +4.1%). Also reporting and also higher (after big losses early) is CYS Investments (CYS +0.8%).
    • CYS is a particularly interesting case as it appears to hedge less than most, and thus may be the purest sector play on the yield curve. It's down a whopping 17% this year and trades at more than a 20% discount to Dec. 31 book value.
    • Other players today: AGNC Investment (AGNC +2%), Two Harbors (TWO +1.6%), Chimera (CIM +1.9%), Invesco (IVR +2.2%), Western Asset (WMC +1.3%), AG Mortgage (MITT +2.2%)
    • ETFs: MORL, REM, MORT
    • Previously: Annaly edges higher after Q4 beat (Feb. 14)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:10 PM | 24 Comments
  • GBR

    Energy/Materials - Top Gainers / Losers as of 2:00 pm (2/15/2018)

    • Gainers: GBR +16%. SHLM +10%. EQT +9%. MMLP +7%. NOA +7%.
    • Losers: KGC -8%. ROSE -7%. CCLP -7%. PKD-OLD -6%. SND -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:00 PM | 2 Comments
  • GBTC

    Bitcoin $10K hats come out again

    • Up another 7% today, Bitcoin has pushed all the way to $10,150.
    • Has the crypto become just another risk asset? Bitcoin's bounce at the moment happens to be coinciding rather nicely with the rebound in stock prices.
    • The bears, meanwhile, are dragging out charts of the Nikkei circa 1989, the Nasdaq circa 2001, and the homebuilders circa 2006 to show the Bitcoin price pattern (parabolic to $20K, plunge to $6K, now retrace to $10K) fits in rather nicely with the collapse of other asset bubbles.
    • Related tickers: OTCQX:GBTC, COIN, RIOT, OSTK, SSC-OLD, MARA, UEPS, OTC:BITCF, XNET, GROW, OTCPK:BTSC, OTCQB:BTCS, OTCQB:MGTI, OTCPK:BTLLF SRAX, OTCPK:GAHC, OTC:ARSC, OTCPK:USTC, OTCPK:BLKCF, COINB, OTCPK:LFIN
     
     
     
     
    | 1:45 PM | 103 Comments
  • EVOK

    Evoke's planned FDA submission for Gimoti extended to next quarter; shares down 11% on women-only indication

    • Thinly traded nano cap Evoke Pharma (EVOK -11.3%) is down on more than triple normal volume, albeit on turnover of only 266K shares, in response to its announcement that it expects to file its U.S. marketing application next quarter for Gimoti (metoclopramide) for the relief of symptoms associated with acute and recurrent diabetic gastroparesis in women.
    • The company also announced that further analyses of pharmacokinetic data showed significant differences in metoclopramide exposure between men and women, much lower in men, prompting their exclusion from its marketing application. The company's decision to seek approval for women only will restrict the targeted treatment population since men represent ~20% of diabetic gastroparesis cases.
    • Previously: Evoke to submit U.S. marketing application for Gimoti in Q1; shares ahead 14% preamarket (Oct. 23, 2017)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:12 PM | 1 Comment
  • ARES

    Financials - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 1:00 PM (02/15/2018)

    • Gainers: ARES +12%. NTB +10%.SBCF +8%. JP +7%. UFCS +7%.
    • Losers: FPAY -20%. NHLD -15%. TRUP -5%. FRSX -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:00 PM
  • ABBV

    AbbVie bumps dividend 35%, to buy back $10B of stock

    • AbbVie (ABBV +1%) announces a 35% increase in its quarterly cash dividend to $0.96 per share. In addition, the board has authorized a new $10B stock repurchase program.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:56 PM | 59 Comments
  • UUUU

    Energy Fuels names Chalmers as President/CEO, Frydenlund as CFO

    • Energy Fuels (UUUU -2.6%) announces changes in top management, appointing Mark Chalmers as its new President and CEO, General Counsel David Frydenlund as CFO, and Eexcutive VP Paul Goranson as COO.
    • Chalmers joined UUUU in July 2016 after serving as executive GM of production for Paladin Energy, where he oversaw operations of the Langer Heinrich and Kayelekera mines in Africa.
    • Frydenlund will replace current CFO Daniel Zang, who will leave the company on March 1; UUUU says Frydenlund has worked in the U.S. uranium mining industry since 1997.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:49 PM
  • ABBV

    AbbVie shares halted pending news

    • Nasdaq has suspended trading in AbbVie (ABBV +1%) pending the release of news.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:44 PM | 49 Comments
  • MBRX

    Midday Gainers / Losers (2/15/2018)

    • Gainers: MBRX +61%. AMAG +29%. GLMD +24%. SEDG +20%. OTCPK:LBCC +21%. BBW +17%. COOL +17%. ANDE +16%. WBAI +15%. ATRS +15%.
    • Losers: INPX -25%. FPAY -20%. CAI -19%. TGH -15%. DMPI -15%. NHLD -14%. THS -14%. LIVE -13%. ADMP -13%. OTC:ARDM -13%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:40 PM
  • KURA

    Kura Oncology up 1% on mid-stage tipifarnib data in HNSCC

    • Kura Oncology (KURA +1.3%) is up on lower-than-average volume on the heels of its announcement of updated results from a Phase 2 clinical trial assessing tipifarnib in patients with head and neck squamous cell carcinomas (HNSCC) with HRAS mutations. The data are being presented today at the Multidisciplinary Head and Neck Cancers Symposium in Scottsdale, AZ.
    • Nine HRAS mutation-positive HNSCC patients have been enrolled to date. 83% (n=5/6) of evaluable patients have experienced partial responses. The other one experienced tumor shrinkage and prolonged cancer stabilization. Two have shown durable responses of more than 18 months.
    • Recruitment is ongoing. Target enrollment is 36.
    • Tipifarnib inhibits an enzyme called farnesyl transferase. Interfering with its function inhibits protein farnesylation, a key signaling process in cancer initiation and development. Farnesyl transferase inhibitors have shown particular promise in blocking HRAS (an oncogene) farnesylation.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:36 PM | 3 Comments

  • TNDM

    Tandem's insulin pump with glucose suspend feature showed benefit in at-home study; investors unmoved, shared down 4%

    • Tandem Diabetes Care (TNDM -4.4%) slips on average volume as investors appear unimpressed with the results from a study evaluating the effect of a predictive low glucose suspend feature in its t:slim X2 Insulin Pump. The results are being presented today at the Annual Conference on Advanced Technologies and Treatments for Diabetes (ATTD) in Vienna, Austria.
    • The study, called PROLOG, compared t:slim X2 with Basal-IQ (the glucose suspend feature) to its standard t:slim X2 Pump in type 1 diabetics over two three-week periods of at-home insulin pump use, one period with each pump.
    • Patients using the pump with Basal-IQ experienced a 31% reduction in the number of sensor glucose readings below 70 mg/dL (threshold for hypoglycemia) compared to the standard pump. The positive impact on hypoglycemia was achieved with no increase in the rate of high glucose (hyperglycemia).
    • CEO Kim Blickenstaff says, “Reducing the risk of hypoglycemia has been the most requested feature of automated insulin delivery in our market research, due to the severity of the complications when left untreated. The data from this study supports our mission to improve the lives of people with diabetes through new innovations, such as the t:slim X2 Pump with Basal-IQ technology. These results will support a PMA submission that we are on track to submit this quarter, and we continue to prepare for a launch in summer of 2018, pending FDA review and approval.”
     
     
     
     
    | 11:45 AM | 3 Comments

  • CELG

    Celgene's Otezla shows positive effect in mid-stage UC study; shares up 2%

    • Celgene (CELG +2.2%) is up on below-average volume in response to its announcement of positive results from a Phase 2 clinical trial evaluating OTEZLA (apremilast) in patients with active ulcerative colitis (UC) who had failed at least one prior line of treatment but no biologic therapy. The data were presented at ECCO in Vienna, Austria.
    • The primary endpoint was the proportion of subjects achieving clinical remission at week 12 as measured by Total Mayo Score (TMS). 21.8% (n=12/55) of patients receiving 40 mg of OTEZLA twice daily achieved clinical remission compared to 13.8% (n=8/58) for placebo (p=non-significant).
    • In the 30 mg apremilast arm, 31.6% (n=18/57) of patients achieved clinical remission versus placebo's 13.8% (p<0.05).
    • The FDA has designated apremilast an Orphan Drug for pediatric UC. OTEZLA was approved in the U.S. in 2014 for plaque psoriasis and psoriatic arthritis.
